During the rainy season, most of the urban migrants who are studying (and some of the ones who are working) return to Djobel to help in the rice fields, and the population increases up to about 500 inhabitants. Thereby, the workforce (men, women, youth and active elderly) almost triples (161.9% growth; see Table 3). The number of migrants who return to their household in the rainy season varies from zero to eleven, with an average of more than four (Table 2). Each household has an average increase of four people during the rainy season, which corresponds to an 80.1% increase in the number of household members.
